31108007.review:
If you go into the three LiEat tales expecting a typical or expansive RPG experience; don't.
It's much more narrative focused with the gameplay amounting to little more than a barebones "examine around until you find the powerful gear and extra restoration items, then grind just a tad" affair with the occasional puzzle to drive home the mystery theme. Sadly, most of the interesting puzzles and gameplay consequences are exclusive to LiEat III and kept sparse between the other two.

LiEat's appeal primarily lies with its snappy personality filled dialogue exchanges between characters, utilizing bittersweet tones to good effect and visual presentation, featuring some nice dark and not so dark fairy tale motifs and the occasional non-sprite animated segment (something rare to find in Wolf RPG editor titles). It's a cute/neat looking game to be sure and a nice little collection of reads if you have the patience to figure out what to do next, but alas it finishes off like a read that was just getting to a good part before snapping shut with no continuation in sight.

I found myself quite enjoying the setting and general idea of LiEat but was also finding that, as deduction + lie eating as a gameplay mechanic was never capitalized on nor amounted to anything outside of flavor text, perhaps the whole thing would've worked better as a novel like the prequel was rather than using a not so great RPG as a medium to relay the story. But for that bite-sized price that nets you three games, which occasionally becomes nibble-sized sales depending, I'd say it's still worthy of checking out if one finds the basic premise appealing.

30930703.review: I didn't expect this game to be good. I bought it for like $.99 or $1.99 on a sale expecting a generic game I could play for laughs. Instead, I got a game with a compelling story that, while I only spent 3 hours playing, I enjoyed every minute of. The normal price is $2.99, and I'd say that the price is worth it for what you're getting. Unless you're a soulless husk, I gurantee you'll enjoy the game. The storytelling is top tier, with a narrative that does wonders getting you to care about the characters in a relatively short time, which is something many AAA titles have trouble doing in 60 hours. The pixel art looks decent in game, but really comes to life in the short cutscenes and other artwork (such as portraits). These really help the characters pop and really brings them to life. The soundtrack is just phenomenal, with the boss music doing a great job to set the mood. The only 2 things I didn't like about the game was the lack of an options menu (so no volume adjustment or fullscreening) and 2 of the 3 endings for Chapter 3. Other than that, it's really a phenomenal game with great music, a great narrative, and great artwork. Spend $3.00 and you won't be disappointed.

30910443.review:
[h1]Sweet little lies[/h1]

LiEat is a short jrpg with simple combat based on the unique premise that you can see lies and eat them.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=897291422

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Hindered by acutely hidden event flags. The game refuses to progress until you talk to the correct NPCs in the correct order and examine the right items at the right time. What a nuisance. 

[b]Visual[/b]
The game runs at a low resolution with sprite work that isn't partiuclarly noteworthy. There are brief videos sprinkled throughout that emphasize cuteness. 

[b]Sound[/b]
Only a handful of songs, many of which will grate on your nerves after about the fifth loop. 

[b]Plot[/b]
Very creative premise but entirely too short to invest the player. The game is split into 3 separate, unrelated chapters. With each one lasting an hour and only a handful of characters, you'll likely see most of the plot twists coming.

[b]Spectacle[/b]
Other than a dozen cute animations and an adorable protagonist, there isn't much noteworthy about this game.

[b]Difficulty[/b]
Without a guide you'll be running laps around the map wondering what item you need to click on to just progress the game. Other than that, you have to go out of your way to die. You can save at any time. 

[b]Two and a half out of five stars[/b]
Decidedly average. I'd prefer if event-flag triggering items would sparkle to signal that the player needs to examine them.

谎言和真话的设定：你判断某句话是谎言，你可以攻击它，女主会吃掉它。不小心攻击了真话也没事，女主只是说一句真话很难吃而已。

成就解锁：一些成就需要切换到英文版，具体方法是把steam语言改成英文，然后在游戏属性里面选测试的原本选项的另一个选项，好像叫beta什么的那个，打开游戏之后选英文就能够切换了。

30733423.review:
I really did not expect this much appreciation for this game. I saw this game a while back and being a lover for pixel graphics, I placed it in my wishlist for a while. Bought it on sale, and pursued to try it out. And I loved it.

The game actually splits into three hour-long games, depending on how you play, and each has it's own interesting and individual story. You follow the characters Theo, a con man, and Efina, a lie-eating dragon, as they travel to town after town, figuring out information they can later sell to earn most of their money. However, they come across some dangerous situations, from vampires to a phantom thief.

The "RPGness" of this game is rather simple. There's no real strategy to winning, other than using powerful weapons you find while exploring the area around you, which is the best way to complete battles. Hence, the game focuses more on character development, dialogue, and exploration to drive the game forward. The different endings add a good small variety to the game, and the game progresses as there is an actual universe in the game that conflicts impact the ending.

All in all, I really enjoyed all three games. Althought the slight limitations of doing your own thing are low, the story is genuinely good and original. Even though the puzzles sort of play themself, I was immersed in the story greatly, and actually felt emotinal with all the endings.

30697925.review:
『らいーと』と読むそうな

RPGというよりかはRPG要素のあるADVといった感じ
RPG要素は正直あんまりプラスにはたらいているとは思えないが、三時間前後でクリアできてしまうので苦にもならない
全実績解除を目指してもプレイ時間にさほど変わりないでしょう

本作『LiEat』の最大の魅力は主人公の一人でありヒロインであるEfina（エフィーナ）の可愛さにあると思う
純真な少女（[strike]幼女[/strike]）であるエフィーナが、街の人びととの出会いや会話によって、その純真さを失わずに成長していくさま、
また同時にエフィーナと接した人びとが、彼女のこころに触れて、ほんのちょっとだけ優しさをや純粋な気持ちを思い出すさま、
これらの情景はとても心がとてもあたたまる。かわいいんですよ、とにかくエフィーが……！
エフィーナともう一人の主人公レオ（仮名）、この二人の旅をもっともっと見たい！強くそう感じられました

ヴィジュアル面も非常に良い
立ち絵や一枚絵だけでなく、何度か挿入されるアニメーションも素晴らしいものでこの作品独自の魅力の一つであると言っていい。BGMも良し
つまり文章だけでなく音と絵でもわれわれの心に訴えかけてくるのだ、エフィーの可愛さを……！

フリーで公開されているということを考えると300円と言う値段は決して良コスパとはいえないがモノ自体は悪くないし、
このSteamという[strike]むさ苦しい[/strike]荒野においては「女の子がかわいいゲーム」という点だけで価値があると思わないだろうか？
買って損はないと思います。トレカ・コミュニティアイテムの質もそこそこ良いし

解密探索加微战斗的童话风小游戏。
在这个长得像人的龙与人类共存的世界，男主是22岁的欺诈师，他的女儿是2个月大的龙，长着4岁女孩的外表、这年轻美貌的一对简直猛戳我萌点！！这个人设每篇章都会换呢！还有一对都是龙的灵异警察探长和副探长简直舔舔舔！日漫和童话风结合，画面异常美丽…………

游戏有三个篇章：

男主谜一样的童年及过去……（哎呀好喜欢小时候的故事）

30640363.review:
LiEat is a short RPG game with adorable characters and beautiful soundtrack. Quick, simple and easy, this is a game that you find yourself playing beneath a tree whilst having a picnic to the harmony of birds chirping in a distance. It is a game where you can relax and enjoy playing and not stress around hard bosses or puzzles.

Pros:
- Amazing soundtrack
- Cute and simple artsyle
- Relaxing atmosphere

Cons:
- Basic combat system; no excitement or skill whatsoever
- Really fast to finish
- Pretty much a glorified visual novel (not really a 'game')

Despite the negative aspects of my review, it was still a most enjoyable experience playing LiEat. You also get 3 games from a single cheap purchase,, so it's definitely worth the price and time.

8/10

30481435.review:
LiEat is a really cute game that made me a lot of joy. 
But if you're searching for a deep  plot or challenging puzzles / good battle system, I must disappoint you.
It's main selling point is it's aesthetic and how pleasant it is to play, making it a game that should be played when down or just in need for a cutesy fluff story. 

Pros
+ great artstyle
+ it's easy to play through, kinda a feel good game
+ really, really cute 
+ multiple endings and cutscenes
+ fluid
+ it's really pleasant to look at

Neutral
o the battle system isn't something new, nor is it really engaging
o the story is somewhat predictable with some neat suprises here and there, but not bad by any means
o OST is nothing outstanding nor outright bad, but actually has some tracks I enjoyed
o really nice concept, not explored deeply enough tho

Cons
- relies (for me) heavily on the art style to get the most enjoyment
- if you're searching for a challenging gameplay / story you're wrong here
- consequences for making a wrong choice are somewhat nonexistent 

tl;dr
It's a neat feel-good game with a really pleasant art style and aesthetics. 
You'll enjoy it a lot if you like the art style a lot or just want to play a relaxing game.

30242394.review:
Watching the short trailer video for LiEat, I already knew I wanted to play it as I adore RPG's. LiEat is a trilogy of short games lasting around one - two hour each and you follow around a young guy and his pet dragon called Efina solving mysteries. It's one of the only games I own on steam, that I would recommand to every friends I have. The game is worth the money and doesn't feel like a $3 game at all. If you're just considering buying the game because it's cheap, do it. It's well worth it.

It took me a total of nine hours to complete all three LiEat games and also complete all the achievements for each game. Sometimes I did have to start a new game to do an achievement but as a completionist and i forgot to save it two times, I didn’t mind, it was worth it. 

So let’s talk about the  style, it was lovely and cute imo, kind of has an anime/VN vibe to it and the little characters in the game are adorable as well!!. Simple but with the perfect amount of detail when it’s needed. Also, when you progress through the game, you will come across crucial moments where there would be a short animation clip, just to make the game more visually appealing which I really appreciated. If you can’t get enough of the clips and you would want to view it again, once you complete the game your character will be transported to the ending room where you can look back at images and clips you came across in the game and also read more information on the characters in the game.

The games themselves aren’t hard to beat, really, but the last installment will require the player to look up a walkthrough if they want the good ending, due to the very random, very specific requires that must be achieved in order to unlock the good ending.

The mysteries in the games were very good and a lot of fun to explore and figure out, and the characters were all very diverse. I was incredibly pleased when the police dragons continued to show up throughout the series as well. Awesome game. Ten out of ten. (What can I say? I’m a sucker for a good story.) I would probably have to rate this teen and up though for the blood and the second chapter’s setting, which while not too graphic, is something kids probably shouldn’t be learning about quite yet.

30221738.review:
[h1] 谎言那样的污秽物，并不是用来守护人类的东西	[/h1]
关于谎言的一个短小精悍的日式RPG

因为之前貌似WIN10不兼容而后偶然翻出来发现可以玩了
挺良心的RPG（虽然成就系统貌似有问题）
内容大概可以说是三个关于谎言的小故事（或者说一个？毕竟主角都相同）
刚开始玩的时候觉得有点不明所以，上来什么都不交代，所以一些有伏笔的话感觉都怪怪的（回收成就的时候再去看看倒也感触颇多）整体节奏把握的挺好，角色成长刻画都比较细腻，挖的坑后期也都好好地填了，所以全部玩下来也不会有哪里堵塞的感觉。
BGM挺赞，对气氛的烘托都很到位，整体来说算是偏向黑童话风格？(并不清楚)
游戏能探索的内容并不多，甚至可以说非常少。[spoiler](三部隐藏道具都是装备，传奇刀传奇饼干啥的，对游戏平衡没多大影响，毕竟这游戏战斗方面非常简单)[/spoiler]但立绘cg和短动画都非常良心！就凭这些我都觉得回本了！另外每个阶段人物的对话都会变化，算是这游戏为数不多的细节处理吧。
关于结局 [spoiler]be没虐到我，只是主角组都黑化了(类似大海原be，少有偏差)。倒是ne，最虐心，也最现实，最符合当时情境。he就属于发糖了，虽然这么说但是还是喜欢he(病，得治)[/spoiler]
最后，Efina太萌辣！现在想骑的龙和以前想骑的龙.jpg
Teo和Efina你们快领证去啊！
还有作者快把中文版成就bug修复了啊！没有全成就难受死了！

总之，推荐。

30043555.review:
TL;DR: LiEat is a fun and charming game that is more than worth 3 dollars despite not being gameplay heavy and harboring 3 episodic chapters.

I purchased this game looking to kill time for under six dollars and was returned with much more than I was expecting.  I believe that LiEat is a very easily enjoyable game for those who don't mind playing something light on gameplay.

The game is split into three chapters that each follow a pattern of the main characters, Efi and Leo arriving at a town, the player meets and interact with the other characters, a mysterious event occurs, the police captains, Brett and Neil, show up and investigate the mystery alongside Efi and Leo and they catch the culprit who is one of the previously introduced characters.  A heartwarming ending follows if the player chooses to achieve the good ending of each chapter. Each chapter takes 1-2 hours to get through.

The gameplay tends to be on the lighter side as it is almost impossible to die unless you are trying to achieve that.  Until the last chapter, you are already given all the healing materials needed and it is possible to find extra. You will be fighting small monsters called little lies throughout the duration of the game and leveling up, gainging strength and skills to fight with until you reach the end of the chapter which results in a boss fight.  From these fights you usually take very little damage until the boss fight and it is very easy to heal.  In fact, it is possible to pick up special, stronger, weapons if you look for them within the game which makes fights pretty easy.  The characters walk at a nice pace and the controls are easy to figure out but i would have prefered if there was a screen that listed the controls, especially since the title of the game window was left untranslated from Japanese and as a result many don't know that F4 will convert the screen to take up the desktop.

Despite the lightness of the gameplay (if light gameplay does not suit your tastes), and the episodic nature of the chapters this game boasts an incredible amount of charm and likeability that is unshakeable to me.  Leo and Efina are fun and interesting characters which create nice foils to one another.  Leo's cunning and mysterious past as well as Efina's innocence and many other childlike qualities  are fun to watch on screen and make interacting with other characters twice as enjoyable.  Though, the characters introduced each chapter tend to be likeable by just themselves. The animated cutscenes and music look and sound especially nice adding just another reason to like this game.

LiEat is definety worth your 3 dollars and is a charming and enjoyable to pick up at anytime.

30037380.review:
5.8小时已通关。我好兴奋啊！！！我含着满口的糖来写评价了！！！这游戏真的超级超级超级棒啊！！！少女心要炸了啊！！！啊！！！
这游戏的卡贼贵，但是我合完出了稀有背景，一本满足。有中文版真是太好了，希望开发商另一作Alicemare也能汉化。
……好接下来我们严肃地谈游戏吧。涉及剧透等等的会隐藏掉。
写正式内容之前先吐槽一下，我觉得男主逆生长啊，从1到3立绘年龄看上去一作比一作小。女主倒是有长大的感觉啦。我一直很萌这样的年龄差+身高差cp。在玩1的时候就开始萌上这对无法自拔了，全程发糖，玩得特别开心。1和2尤其是2都是蛮小清新的风格，3有点点恐怖因素，敌人啪唧地冒出来是有点点吓人。不过说到底还是个萌系游戏。
以下正文。
[b]画面[/b]
我好喜欢好喜欢像素风的游戏的，尤其是这样像素风还很有特色的游戏。感觉每一作色调都不一样，1偏粉2偏蓝3偏绿。很喜欢这种统一色调的感觉。像素立绘特别好看，不过1里面的哥哥我看像素图还以为是个漂亮大姐姐。CG画风很棒敲可爱，最让我觉得不可思议的是这样的小游戏居然还带动画……虽然不长但是让人感觉诚意满满啊。
[b]音乐[/b]
我这个人很少对BGM产生感想所以不多说，可能因为是乐盲吧。三作BGM气氛都做得到位这在我这就合格了。而且在此之上我觉得还蛮好听的诶……
[b]战斗[/b]
2有贼牛逼的装备还碰巧被我乱点捡到了。我不知道1有没有反正3应该是没有的。毕竟3是完结作得一本正经一点。这种剧情向游戏里的战斗反正难不到哪里去，练级也非常快。敌人设置挺弱主角挺强，正常练级不作死基本死不了。关于收集结局建议是：[spoiler]因为每一代打boss之前都会有一段让你练级，而1一个BE和2代BE是要求boss战输掉的，所以建议在练级之前存个档。我尴尬地碰到过boss打我不掉血的情况。[/spoiler]
[b]剧情[/b]
这剧情我给满分没话说。完全满足了我想吃糖的心。[spoiler]但是为什么要暗示寿命论啊！这样我很心痛啊！[/spoiler]三作从治愈到致郁程度的顺序是2大于1大于3NE大于3BE大于3HE。把3的NE排在BE前面是因为我觉得[spoiler]BE里好歹两个人都活着啊！NE里Efi直接嗝屁了是哪样啊！而BE反倒给人一种Efi迟早能救Teo的希望。另外其实我是有点纠结把1排哪里的，因为三作如果不算3的NE的话只有1是死了人的。[/spoiler]LiEat是个萌萌的带点黑暗的小故事集。我很希望再继续出下去啊，主角二人组实在太可爱。出收费DLC我也买啊……
[b]人设[/b]
喜欢除了蛇女和怪盗以外的所有角色。我觉得Efi小只的时候比较可爱，完全体虽然很好看但是没有那种傻不拉唧的萌感了。以及感觉Teo从1到2感觉话多了很多啊，是受Efi影响还是受身份影响呢。其次喜欢Bretta，我有点忘记是不是这么拼的了。作为三作一直都出场的角色Bretta的身世介绍总感觉比同样是三作出场配角的队长少了。要是故事结束以后她能像她自己期望的一样喜欢上人类就好了。
这个游戏我实在没想出有什么不足。一定要说的话就是好希望再多做几个故事。总体来说物超所值，如果不是流程短我感觉价格翻一倍都没问题啊……真的好喜欢这个游戏啊。玩到它真是太好了。

29948472.review:
The only one of all games I own on steam, that I would recommand to every friends I have.

Stories are short and cute. Normally when I play games like this, I think "Oh I knew this story and I know how it would end". But while playing LiEat, the most thing attracts me is each character has its own personality. The words they use, the way of thinking. I do believe that these characters come from author's real life. This makes the story so real.

BGM are really awesome and I do enjoy it while reading the conversation. You won't feel bored even you keep listensing the same music for an hour.

The battle is simple, especially when you find some nice weapon. But the key part is how you find clue, and it does affect the ending you get. 

Also, there're some 'Eastern eggs' that are really interesting.

I would say it is the game that I'm looking for, and again I recommand this game to all my friends.

Overall: 10/10 and worth at full price.

普通結局與好結局的流程相同，只是差在Efi的等級

29742413.review:
之前买的时候没注意，入库了才发现有评测说LiEat有三部[spoiler]章[/spoiler]，吓得我差点退款
[spoiler]然而是三合一233333[/spoiler]
怎么说呢，玩完之后的第一感觉是
好短！从第一章到第三章都好短！
可能是因为从海囚的游戏入坑的缘故，我之前对个人制作的RPG游戏印象基本是“嗨呀既然有辣么方便的软件那肯定很容易做长剧情啦”，结果就是通关LiEat第一章的时候一脸懵逼地坐在电脑前
[strike]蛤[/strike]哈？这怎么就完了？后边的神展开呢？不是应该来一段操控吸血鬼妹妹体验可歌可泣的家庭纠纷的桥段才对吗？怎么突然就给我To Be Continued了？
然后就很气，就感觉自己受到了欺骗，就很想退款[spoiler]其实只是被海囚惯坏了而已[/spoiler]
结果通关第一章之后给我来了个特典房间
看了看发现，原来这么短的游戏里有这么多CG和动画啊……
好像一章的CG量已经够得上海囚一整部游戏的CG量了……
这么一算的话，三章近30张CG还有一堆短动画……感觉莫名地赚了？
总的来说这个游戏战斗方面中规中矩（毕竟个人制作）
人物塑造方面因为每章实在有点短的缘故，除了Efina和Teo之外基本都没多大印象[spoiler]Efi酱超可爱！[/spoiler]
重点是，这游戏在CG啊动画啊立绘啊这几个方面超！级！良！心！
每一章的Efi和Teo都有不同的立绘，而且还有各种CG和短动画，简直用心到爆！
就冲这一点，15块钱买这游戏绝对值！

29735206.review:
there's a certain attraction i have with indie games with story telling like a picky heroin addict. Most triple AAA companies don't fill that niche because their more involved with violence, scenery and massive [strike]erections[/strike] explosions. The whole game in it's three episodes have managed to reel me in like a hungry shark, or more appropriately attracting a story telling audience with a game that leaves you emotionally satisfied, and if your like me you will be walking around the house reminising, and scaring the crap out of you family members.

[u]atmosphere[/u]
the art style is the first thing you will focus on the first time you play. it has a minimalist, yet very thoughtfully lay'ed out placement of locations and people. it manages to fit the tone of the story in a semi-realistic world [spoiler](yes there is magic, but there are also cellphones and GUNS that are known to be really powerful, in a world that shouldn't have things like that)[/spoiler]. characters are interesting and well rounded, and has a very good pace of story without text dumping the player.

the music in this game is, wow. it's not fully real orchestral music but its so good that you could be listening to it for hours and not get sick of it. its sort of like a renaissance/pop music and every time i start an episode, the music would be spot on for atmosphere. it is something that will make you stick with it longer and will probably encourage you more to show the game to your friends or family member.

the story in the game is as unique as it is engaging as this game. you play as two people, a con artist and the lie eating dragon, which at first doesn't look anything like one. but the story unfolds in this surreal, but believable world. the main focus of the game is to rid the selected location of lie's which take fiscal form and if it goes on for too long, the liar who spawns them will get consumed by the lies. imagine living in a world like that, where if you lied, your in more risk of getting yourself killed by your own lies. Surprisingly most people in the game world don't care and if you think realistically enough, it would be taken seriously and anything that encourages lying would get decimated. so the story and the believability of some of the people are a little off, not bad but might take you out of the experience a few times.

[u]gameplay[/u]
Ok to be honest, I never played many of these rpg games. I'm not talking about rpg games like Lisa and Hyics that have a focus on combat mixed with story (if you can call hylics a story driven game). I'm talking about story driven rpgs that have an influence from Japanese culture and a style in minimalist form, like Ib, the witches house and yume nikki. The ones that do have combat in the traditional turn based formula tend to be, meh.

The combat in the game is your average rpg combat, and i don't have to sing you the bloody formula. you do reset to your starting lvls every new episode, but your abilities are so small and basic it's not anything to go on about. But even with the combat in the game its like that annoying plastic wrapping around salami. you have to take it off to eat it and, even if it's tedious you still have a tasty salami to eat, and people are only mildly annoyed by it.

[u]conclusion[/u]
lieat is a unique story driven game with a lot of original ideas to hook you in, painfully by the mouth. it's a really good game that serrate you and makes you into sushi for it's customers. if you don't want to die like that, that are other games that would suit you like DOOM that blows you up with a rocket launcher in Indonesia. or Thief gold that makes you run for your life from a hunter and into a spike trap [spoiler](man i'm talking alot about linking pain with pleasure)[/spoiler].

29619569.review: LiEat is a wonderful little game, where you're actually given three different stories centered around the main protagonists of the game. The story is very interesting, and the characters do are mostly memorable. Its art style is cute, although my main issue of the game was that I kept confusing one of the protagonists with some of the other characters (but that might just be me with not paying attention to the charater sprites while I'm reading). The music is wonderful and there are times that the game can be quiet, but it adds a bit of suspense. Even though the game is pretty short, you can consider this like a beginner's guide to rpgs and jrpgs (especially if you're a completionist/story-goer). Overall, I really liked this game as a whole!

三个简短却温馨的小故事~
一场爸爸（雾）带着女儿的冒险旅途~

不得不说刚开始觉得这种带点像素画的画风有点怪怪的，但是接受这个设定之后意外的萌上了~很喜欢这对父女组（大雾），吵闹中带着温情，不论是警骑队的两个小哥哥的设定，或是其他每一个登场人物，虽然出场时间不长，但是都个性鲜明讨人喜欢~

独特的像素分画面和BGM，带点解密的探险游戏，但里面主要以剧情为主，小解密基本没有什么卡关点[spoiler] （虽然我在第一个故事里因为没看到最上面两个房子之间的小道被卡了半个小时๑乛 з乛๑主要是因为我太笨啦）	[/spoiler]故事也比较吸引人~特别是每一个章节小故事过了，都有一个总汇房间能重温这个故事里出现的CG与BGM让我很喜欢~~

唯一的不足可能是我刚开始自己没看清楚游戏的配置，第一次玩的时候不高的清晰度确实让我挺吃惊的，但是习惯了也是魔性的挺喜欢这种风格的(〃￣︶￣)丿

总的来说真的很推荐入手的一款游戏~而且也不贵~用几瓶饮料的钱，和Efi一起来一场小小的充满神奇冒险的旅途又何尝不好呢？

花了六个多小时已全部通关，其实较早前也有通过作者的Pixiv有了解到这款游戏，但因为生活也算繁忙 [spoiler] 天天摸鱼身体棒 天天吃鸡吃不胖	[/spoiler]，一直没有查找相关信息。
年前刚回到家，苦于家里低配置的电脑玩不起什么配置要求过硬的游戏，就在steam上想要找点不吃配置的游戏，便第二次遇见了Lieat，发现也不贵，便愉快喜+1。

作者的人设与作画都蛮符合我个人喜好的，三部的剧情安排也很满意，渐渐地也都能了解到故事背景与人物故事，不紧不慢，看着也很开心，没有太多的解密要素，这点我比较喜欢。[strike] 毕竟有些人天生就智商不足	[/strike] ，[spoiler] 但是为什么最后是进入墙上的眼睛才是真结局啊是不是一开始某个房间里那个眼睛这么恶心人的真正用意吗！	[/spoiler]

故事虽然不长，但一些情节给人的感觉还是很不错的。
Teo这么多年一个人过，小Eri的诞生仿佛就是来拯救他一样。多年来我自己对人生的理解都以“自渡”为基础，对于伴侣好像可有可无。但是好像只有一个人，灵魂似乎就不完整了。
可能是我个人的毛病，什么都喜欢想太多，但游戏最终给我传达的故事，真的十分温馨。


所以。。。。。。




[h1] 请给我一个像Eri的女儿吧！	[/h1]

29298788.review:
[b]首先是中文版本进入崩溃问题的解决方法：[/b]

 [quote=MarineZZ]beta2测试版本：游戏库→LiEat（右键）→属性→测试→输入“ChineseTest1128”→再选择上方多出来的beta2版本就可以了，steam会重新下载beta的新内容，下完开游戏就好。[/quote]

[h1]当你想用谎言去拯救荒芜世界的温情的话，那么你不一定会成功[/h1]

  在这个魔法世界里，一切有智慧，能够沟通，开口说话的物种都可以被称之为人类

  但是，除了跳出这一设定的种族 

  [b]龙[/b]

  众所周知，龙总是特别的。这里也不例外。龙作为有智慧的稀有物种，日子却不一定好过
  有些成为玩物，有些成为奴隶。因此有些龙族孩子不得不隐藏自己的身份，活在茫茫人海中

  所以，一般的龙并不喜欢人类
  但是，龙却是因人类无比的执念而诞生的存在。因为人的强烈愿望而来到这个矛盾魔法世界
龙因为使之诞生的人的夙愿不同，而有着各种各样的能力

  比如，TEO善意的谎言想让兄弟们更好的生活，但是最后却孑然一人，兄弟姐妹不明真相地反目而祈愿有一种存在能够吃掉当初自己说出的谎言的存在。于是一只龙蛋就出现在TEO的面前，里面就是能够分辨谎言而吃掉谎言的EFI

  但是，我想，如果时光倒流，TEO还是会选择这么去做。
  他明白了，EFI的存在不是为了吃掉当初的谎言，而是确定自己并没有做错。能够去面对真正的自己，去面对自己的兄弟与姐妹，那就够了。[strike]能够跟可爱女儿一起旅行，还不够了！？[/strike]

[b]那么来看我浅析下优缺点[/b]

[olist]
    [*]+优秀的独立RPG小品，麻雀虽小，五脏俱全。虽然不大，但是该有的JRPG元素该有的都有
    [*]+可爱的哥特式风格，插画很梦幻系，很Q，比较符合大众审美。游戏里面的像素口袋妖怪风也很讨喜啊（喂）
    [*]+各种明快的BGM，能够跟上当时的剧情发展
    [*]+小谜题很有趣，还有TEO用女儿当测谎仪真是太溜了
    [*]+EFI！！！
[/olist]

[olist]
    [*]-虽然乍一看分为了1，2，3部，可是每一部的剧情都是分开的（联系不大）并且单从剧情来看，有些地方还是显得过渡的不太圆滑。从整体上来看，虽然这是最为一篇小品，但是剧情还是短，短，短，不能够叫人尽兴。不过15腿子来说已经很好了
    [*]-中文版的问题好久了也不解决，这么放着虽然也可以玩，但是还是希望能够解决下，不再去用beta
    [*]-用beta游玩有些地方不会正常解锁成就（比如10级成就）。还需要用英文版里面解一遍，实在是糟心
[/olist]

  不过我很喜欢，也很期待欺诈师大哥与龙族小萝莉的爱（亲）情故事。（虽然再延长就狗尾续貂了）

  P.S.既然是JRPG,记得一定要去翻箱倒柜！里面有武器还有钱（用处不大），成就

  以及

  [b]龙族萝莉找到了霸霸的原味胖次，兴奋的戴在了头上[/b]
  
  [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=843039180] 哦呵呵[/url]

29261829.review: Great story and art. As a puzzle solving detective game, this game really shines. I felt each of the stories was interesting in their own way, and after playing the 3rd chapter, I was glad I did in fact play them in order and experienced the story the way it was meant to (which you arent forced to do by the way). As an RPG it is mostly unbalanced, with most enemies being far too easy, then having a chapter boss that is extremely difficult.  The key to succeeding is finding the hidden equipment that is all hidden in vague places, along with not avoiding battles, and finding the hidden health restoration items (which are the only ways to heal other than sleeping in beds, which the game kinda leaves up to you to assume that it heals you and never points it out). I enjoyed this game. Though I 100% cleared all 3 chapters of the game with all achievments and all of the different endings to each chapter (each chapter has a good and bad ending, with the 3rd chapter having an additional neutral ending as well) in less than 5 hours. This was with the help of guides however, as some of the sections that require you to talk to specific people after certain events, had me confused. So without a guide, this may possibly be a 6 hour game. Due to the short gameplay length, I would recommend picking this game up when it is on sale, even though the $3 pricetag isn't unreasonable. <3

29221194.review:
I bought LiEat because I am nothing if not a sucker for interesting aesthetics. And JRPGs. The premise is a young dragon girl who can eat lies; that combined with the art style was enough to convince me it was worth the very small price tag.
This game is broken down into three 'parts'. Essentially, each is a self-contained adventure in a confined space that takes about an hour to play through. I'll be honest...I got stuck quite quickly. They take an odd format and presentation that completely stumped me; it dumps your character in an almost empty town and says to go do stuff. What follows is a very linear series of events that are so loosely connected that I highly recommend following a walkthrough.
This sounds like it should be a negative point, but the fun of the game isn't in working out the next step. Instead this should be seen more as a visual novel with token battles and movement that go a long way to investing you in the story. And it is the writing that gets this game a definite recommendation.
You experience the events - that take the form of a series of 'mysteries' to be solved - both from the eyes of the naive and childlike Efi (the lie-eating dragon girl) and her 'father' Leo (an early twenties conman). This split perspective works very well and lets you see the various characters with whom you interact in differing ways that would have been unavailable if your protagonists didn't act independently.
Efi is endlessly cute and acts very much like an actual child would; playing, exploring and making friends with all the shady people Leo regards with cynicism and weariness. She is initially the focus of the game's attention, but this regrettably shifts to what I hesitate to call the 'over-arching plot' in the last part.

Okay. Cards on the table. This game is very short. Four hours to 100% it on my first run. And that includes leaving it running a couple of times while I got distracted and wandered off. I would have absolutely loved if there had been another three or more of the little 'episodes' even if that doubled the price of the game. As it is, the game peaks with the second part and the third part kinda lost me.
The first part focuses largely on the combat which varies from impossible (if you didn't stumble randomly across better weapons) to trivial (if you happened to find the best ones). The second is a mostly conversation-based little story with less combat where Efi is at her best and the third takes a very 'puzzley' attitude that almost forgets combat exists until the end where you need to grind for a couple of minutes.
As I said, I think this game is best played with a guide open (made easier by the fact the resolution CANNOT be changed from a 480p window), allowing you to find the good weapons and get through the weird sequence of interactions you need. Without the 'gameplay' to slow you down, you can explore everything and talk to everyone. It's the talking to everyone that makes this a fun adventure.

Considering I bought this very cheap based mostly on its aesthetics, I am pleasantly surprised by how much I like it. It is crammed full of a cuteness and charm that appeal greatly to me and smother any ill feelings about the relative lack of gameplay or the short runtime. While the third part is by far the weakest, it does end in such a way that a sequel or expansion is not impossible. If one is ever released, I'm sure I will play it and enjoy it simply if it is more of this.

Oh. And the idea of having all art stills and cutscenes viewable at the end of the 'part' is brilliant. They're pretty if few in number and they're worth that second look at the end.

29007282.review:
LiEat is one of those games that you check and don't really know what to expect at first, The Game release on Steam is divided into 3 parts (or 3 games as others users have told before).

Each chapter features the iconic duo of a young humanoid dragon-like child called Efina and her "Papa".

The sprite-like art is gorgeous, the short cutscenes and art leaves the player wanting for more, it also features JRPG like elements as combat and items but falls short in a sense that it very simple and too easy with almost no depth in the combat system, nonetheless it still a game in which fans of JRPG will enjoy for it's stories and lore relations between the games.

It also has achievements and steam cards, which is always nice.

29003340.review:
I watched this game years back, proabably more around when it came out originally. Never actually played it, but I did a run through before I wrote this for my own purposes. [And not just cause I wanted to be able to name the stickers I was sending people on Line haha]

LiEat is a super simple JRPG that features the extramily adorable Efi- Efina if you want her full name- and... Well he's got a lot of names. I loved them both as well as the supporting cast, each with a visually distinct design and their own little quirks. The story of the first two sections is very simple and are likely more focused on getting the player accustomed to the controls and aquainted with the characters. It builds up the mystery that is much more elaborated on in the 3rd part- not that it doesnt introduce its own cast of course. Think of them as one game rather than three, least thats how I do it. They are enjoyable on their own of course, but they are fairly simple imo.

I absolutely adore this game, miwashibas works are some of my favorite of these little rpgs [and I guess perhaps visual novels as of 1bitheart, would you call it that?] and their art is honestly just beautiful. That alone makes me love the game just a bit more- I'm a sucker for art as an artist myself. 
The combat is simple [Albiet perhaps a little too much so, but I'm not particualrly skilled at games a lot so it's a easy game for me to pick up and play] and the controls are easy to get accosomed to. I only had one problem when I was starting the 3rd one, my controller wouldn't get picked up by the game. But, I played something else for a bit and when I went back it was fine. Who knows what happened. 
While the writing and story are very much simple but very nice to read I did feel it was a tad short. Even spread over 3 games. The buildup is very nice but the finale of the 3rd game felt just a tad fast. This isn't a problem exclusive to this game- I had a similar problem with 1bitheart [I haven't experienced AliceMare recently, I might pick that up soon] but I don't retract much with it. 

Overall, I'd defeinitely recommend this game. With a very nice soundtrack and a incredibly heartwarming story I'm glad its reached a bigger audience [aka on steam and not just online haha]

I had this on my wishlist, and a friend gifted it to me (I even forgot that I even put it in my wishlist in the first place), so I decided to play it yesterday. 
This is a beautifully-made game, although it's more like a Visual Novel with a smidge of puzzle-solving and some battle mechanic. The battles are really easy, and so are the puzzles. The real gems here are the story (which is divided into three parts), and the art and music. The sprites are beautifully stylized and fit the game to a T. 
There's almost no replay value, except for perhaps getting achievements that you didn't manage to pick up during your first run, but all in all, this is a good game with fleshed-out characters, and I enjoyed every bit of it.

28891477.review:
If anything, this game is cute, fun, and totally worth the price. LiEat is about a partnership of a lie-eating dragon and a master liar. Together they solve mysteries and find out the truth. The concept itself is interesting and fun enough already.

The story and the gameplay are very simple, which is both a positive asset and a shortcoming. On one hand, you get to understand what's going on right off the bat and it doesn't get any more complicated as you go. This allows you to enjoy the characters' personalities and dialogues rather than having your mind preoccupied with every detail you come across. On the other hand, it takes away the mysteriousness of the detective-esque scenarios. There is no wrong answers or missed clues. All you need to do is talk to everyone and kill monsters to finish the stories. The plot comes off as shallow and it makes it too easy but it's fun to go through nonetheless, and at the end of the day, that's what matters most.

A biggest part of the experience is the very stylish design. From the interface, to the sprites, to the CGs. Not to mention the beautifully animated cutscenes. The music throughout is also very ambient and appropriate to the situation. The second biggest part is the characters. The energetic and optimistic Efina is easily the most fun character to interact with or play as. She is ever so energetic and optimistic. Her childish personality is very entertaining, and it complements the serious, albeit playful, attitude of her partner, the master liar.

What I personally liked most about this game is the chemistry of the two main protagonists which I think is very cleverly constructed. The game has three parts. Each deals with different stories to tell and mysteries to solve. It would be nice to see more sequels for this series.

Would I recommend this game? To a particular group of people, definitely. This isn't a game for all tastes, but for its target audience, I'm sure it will be highly appreciated, especially Efina.

[h1]关于故事整体[/h1]
游戏是关于三个小故事（章节?）进行的，中途演出还有剧情个人感觉都挺不错；有点小解谜要素，不过基本都是按着剧情走多找找就解开了，没什么卡关点，个人体验还是很不错的。[spoiler]除了某个崩溃的问题[/spoiler]

然后就是吐槽的最多的汉化崩溃问题了...

[h1]关于汉化崩溃和成就解锁问题[/h1]
个人是用的作者给的beta2测试版本过的，自己电脑上运行没问题，不过好像第一章和第二章的成就解锁有点问题，这个我还是重新啃了遍英语过的成就2333。希望作者早日修复成就问题那就没什么问题了。
[b]beta2测试版本：游戏库→LiEat（右键）→属性→测试→输入“ChineseTest1128”→再选择上方多出来的beta2版本就可以了，steam会重新下载beta的新内容，下完开游戏就好。[/b]
关于成就解锁：当前因为中文解锁有点问题，我还是用我那半吊子的英语啃过去开成就的，这里就说一下怎么进英文版本的游戏好了。（实际上中文跑第一次剧情再跑次英文很快的）
[b]打开自己steam安放游戏的文件夹目录，以个人为例：F:\Steam\steamapps\common\LiEat
里面有多个语言文件夹，CN是中文，EN是英文，JP是日文，ID和PT两个是另外两个语种。
打开EN文件夹，里面LiEat1,LiEat2,LiEat3分别对应游戏的第一到三章，直接打开Game.exe就可以以英文开始游戏了。（其它语种同理，标题有乱码但一般不怎么影响，F10全屏，F4更改窗口大小，F8显示帧数）[/b]

[spoiler]最后，Efina真是太可爱啦！！[/spoiler]

28819573.review:
I've played a lot of basic rpg games that have mediocre music and graphics and unispired stories, and let me tell you, this is not one of them!

First off, the graphics in this game are beautifully stylized. The characters look colorful and unique without overshadowing the very pretty, if somewhat small, world maps. The game generally sticks to a 16 bit style, although its cheating and going a bit over that limit- to good effect. Interspersed in there are hand drawn frames, stills and animated scenes normally about 3-5 seconds long, that have a simple but colorful style to them that mesh with the normal graphics very well.

 I was not expecting anything more than a 10 second loop track or four with this game and boy was I wrong! This game has at least 8 tracks that are over 1-2 minutes long for each chapter, and I rather liked quite a few of them. They are left open in the games files so you can drag them right onto a music player. They are very soothing to listen to, many of them are quiet music box ones but there are some others that are more robust.

The gameplay itself is rather basic rpg format. turn based with limited ability menus. There are item upgrades if you want to search the wold maps but I found that it really wasnt neccessary until the final chapter when you have to battle a fairly tough boss without your AP recovery guy around. The game itself is extremely short, clocking in at around 4 hours for me to unlock all endings, but I still haven't unlocked over half the acheivements. 

The story is engaging if you like fantasy. Its nothing too mind blowing but still enough to make you cry a little. Reminds me of a Miyazaki film a bit. The characters are easy to grow attached to.

Over all I really enjoyed Lieat a lot more than I thought I would, and highly recommend it for anyone looking for an easier game to chill and get lost in for an evening.

28349820.review:
LiEat is a cute little game about a swindler, Leo, and his dragon daughter Efi. In this world, human is just a term that refers to anyone who walks on two legs - except for one creature, the dragon. Dragons are the only humanoid who can use a magical ability, and for this reason they are hunted and enslaved. They are born from the particularly strong wishes of humans, and this wish gives them the magical power they will have for life. Efina hatched in front of Leo with the ability to manifest lies and eat them. As the plot progresses, you find out why such a rogue would have a need for a dragon like that.

You get three games in one, and it took me around 45 minutes to an hour to do each one. The gameplay is straightforward and easy. There is a turn based combat system, but it's rarely used and seems rather pointless. You can find very, very powerful legendary weapons just by examining objects carefully at the beginning of all the games. The only time you might need to grind the lies instead of just ignoring them is when there are a couple of achievements linked to level (Get Efi to level 10 in part one, and there are two endings to unlock in part three if you are above or below level 13). Most of your time will be spent trying to find out how to trigger the next cutscene, sometimes the directions are not so clear. For example, Leo tells Efi to go explore for a while in part 2, and you have to ask certain NPCs to play with you before sleeping will trigger the next scene. There are also some localisation issues which make finding the next task a little difficult, and there are some sentences which look like they have been translated literally from the Japanese when a more standard English expression would have been clearer. I can't complain though, I do the same thing! And actually I enjoy seeing the original Japanese show through, it's cute. Major props to the translator who was great at interpreting Efi's strange way of reading words (fantathief!).

The art in this small game is absolutely fantastic. There are short animated scenes included at major plot points, and the pixel art and colour palette is so beautiful. It's low-res, but this is a limit with Wolf RPG maker and higher resolution artwork can be found online.

I started LiEat because I wanted to play something similar to Mad Father, but it wasn't quite the same. It's not a horror, just very gothic. Even though the story of LiEat is well-developed I did not find that it was as good at exploring individual characters and motivations as Mad Father, and it would have been nice to learn more about the other characters that pop in and out of the story like Rosalie, Carol, and Iris. Like Rosalie seems to have a history with Leo but she only appears in part one, and doesn't really do anything? The game would have been much the same without her in it. There is also a LiEat novel being translated by the game translator (http://vgperson.tumblr.com/post/130927788020/lieat-the-novel-prologues-part-i) which might add more worldbuilding.

Overall this game is really worth the pocket change it costs to buy, you get a wonderful story for your money. Now I'm looking forward to playing Miwashiba's next game, Alicemare. :)

28283454.review:
[b]A very fun lightweight game that I definitely suggest everyone to try out![/b]

LiEat follows the story of a dragon girl and a conman who constantly lies for various reasons, either for self-gain or advancement of progress. The two make quite a strange team, solving mysteries through the girl's ability eat the lies of people whilst the liar himself lures out the people's lies. All in all, the story and characters are well crafted, each with different backstories that captures a fine detail. Expect giggles and laughs with their humors, and be prepared to face how serious they can be!

The game uses a simple battle system that is akin to the many RPG predecessors (Earthbound, Final Fantasy, etc). Miwashiba managed to keep it fast and easy to learn, anyone unfamiliar with the system is able to figure it out quickly thanks to the descriptions. Since the game wasn't designed to be a grinding fest, you hardly even need to get to a high level in order to beat the storybosses, it's way easy unless you're after the achievements (like me).

Now, the art and sound... Don't even get me started on those! It presents an adorable artstyle, map, battle and cutscenes. The music fits the game's design of being something similar to the Pokemon games, changing based on the current events that are happening. In my opinion, music can change one's mind of thinking, LiEat did a good job in presenting this!

I'll rate it 9/10.
The only problem I have was how short it was. I still wanna know what happened to Theo and Efi after the incident! But that's a story for another time. 

[strike](By the way, I totally would want a dragon of my own :D)[/strike]

The only complaint I could think of is it being too short, but that's only because of my own desire to see more of the characters. The game in itself wraps up pretty nicely, so it's more of a wish than a complaint.

It's something I'll definitely replay in the future, because of the nice story and characters!

The main focus of this game is the actual story and it stays that way through out all 3 parts, with that in mind you don't need to expect grinding in this game so have fun with the story! The artstyle and colours make this game even moreso unique than it would have been if it had a more "generic" style. It kept the game charming and although you are limited to one area in each part, the unique look of sprites and such kept it feeling like a small but new world.

With an interesting plot and characters this game will keep you wanting to know what will happen as you progress into the story and for $2.99 it's really quite a steal. I feel this game could have been a higher price if it was longer (I beat all 3 parts in 5 hours) and had a more in-depth combat system. That being said, it's not a bad game at all especially for its price.
                  [b] Just know that a short and story-focused game like this is very linear so if you hate linear games then LiEat is not for you.	[/b]

[b] 9/10	[/b]

28211347.review:
LiEat is an adorable 3-in-one RPG game with charming artwork, an engaging story, and very lovable characters. However, if you are a hardcore gamer who's looking for a lengthy, action-packed anime game that you can invest hours and hours of gameplay into, then this isn't for you.

One thing I noticed is that the story subtly acknowledges real life. It gave me a small taste of human nature and emphasized how lies can consume a person. *Note, this isn't like a Telltale game,* but I feel it's a cool feature in the story regardless.


[b]Pros to LiEat[/b]
[*]Beautiful artwork and short animated cutscenes
[*]Creative and lovable characters
[*]Immersive storyline
[*]Cute humor [spoiler](You get an achievement for putting panties on your head)[/spoiler]
[*]Great soundtrack
[*]Low Price


[b]Cons to LiEat[/b]

[*]Short
[*]Monotonous combat
[*]Somewhat lengthy dialogue

Some things to keep in mind --I finished all three parts to the game and found all the achievements in under 5 hours. [spoiler](with the help from a guide made by "Hime~")[/spoiler] And, as you can expect from a 2D RPG, the combat is never that much of a challenge. As I also mentioned in the cons list, the dialogue can take a while.... but it's a [u][b]story-based RPG[/b][/u] so I shouldn't really complain about that -especially since the dialogue is well-written.

I recommend LiEat primarily because of its artwork and its storyline. [spoiler]And you can wear panties and goofy glasses!![/spoiler] Now I wouldn't say it's an [i]outstanding[/i] game, but for its price, I'd say it's well worth trying out.

Thank you, game devs! Happy Gaming!
~Xeno

27658641.review:
Short, but extremely pleasent story. The characters are interesting and develop well within the small space given, and make for a nice amount of contrast in the interactions. It has its funny and happy moments, but does gradually develop into something darker and more tense as the plot progresses.

Lovely art styles throughout, with good use of colour and weights.

Make sure to check all the dialogue available! There's a lot of fun dialogue you can very easily miss if you don't check absolutely everything - sometimes multiple times.

I also suggest checking out the novel for the game before playing the last one (The Gold Thief), as it adds a lot more to the overall development of the world and charaters - and is generally a good read, if you enjoy these games.

If I had to make some complaints:
The RPG elements are pretty bare bones. There's almost no real strategy or depth in equipment or combat as all games only have 3 sets, which are purely just going from weaker to stronger, and your enemies do little more than standardly attack you. The battles feel more intended for narrative purposes than actual gameplay. The battle soundtracks are still very worth it however.

Some conversational dialogue is very annoying to get. There are many, many times an NPC will have a total of 3 possible dialogues when you talk to them. The issue is it's random which of the 3 they select, so they can have you potentially be speaking to them over and over and over again trying to see what the last dialogue is because random chances aren't helping you here. It's highly worth seeing as much of the dialogue as possible as it really adds to the game, but it does take a little bit of game-awareness and effort to actually see it all sometimes.

27377496.review:
This is a pretty fun game, and I feel it's definitely worth the price. It's very short, even if you take your time, and the scale of the game is very small. For each chapter of the game, you're confined to only one area, and your stats and items don't carry on between chapters.

...Oh yeah this is an RPG. If you're interested in the game for that, you'll be pretty disapointed. The battle system is best described as really basic, and despite getting gold from every battle, oddly enough I couldn't find anywhere to spend it. Equipment in the game is found by looking around, and there's some really powerful equipment that's not very well hidden. You could almost fight every battle with your eyes closed. I believe that the battles are just there to keep things from getting boring since without them the game would just be wandering around from point A to point B just to hear dialogue here and there. 

Where the game really shines is the story. While it's obviously not shakespeare or whatever, it's enough to hold your interest for the 3 or 4 hours it will take you to beat the game. The world is intriguing, the characters are cool and interesting, and the art is really pretty. I wish the game was in a higher resolution, but I guess it can't be helped.

Overall, LiEat is a really good game, and probably the best 3 dollars you'll ever spend on a video game.

If you haven't played this game yet, you're missing out. Plus, it's only a few bucks, which just adds to the pile of why this game is awesome.

27240016.review:
Je trouve que c'est un beau jeu, hyper mignon esthétiquement, qui représente pourtant un univers sombre où le mensonge est roi. 

LiEat est la contraction de "Lie eater" : l'héroïne est une sorte de démone, mangeuse de mensonges. L'idée générale, c'est d'être attentif à son environnement, aux échanges avec les personnages, et d'identifier les belles paroles en l'air... afin de vous en nourir. 

Les mensonges deviennent des monstres que vous combattrez, au tour par tour comme dans de bons vieux RPG. L'aspect combat n'est pas très développé, au service de l'histoire et de l'univers du jeu. 
La durée de vie de chaque épisode n'est pas très longue, mais on sent que l'univers a été mûrement travaillé, donc autant profiter de cette partie-là.   

La patte graphique est fabuleuse. Je n'ai jamais vu ça ailleurs et c'est vraiment un bel exemple. 
Y mettre du sien et pourquoi pas créer une charte graphique propre à son jeu... c'est le défi de bien de designers. Rien qu'en scollant les screenshots, je pense que vous saurez de quoi je parle. 

Il a un tout petit prix, et en plus de ça, il est assez souvent soldé... Pour tous les amoureux de petits RPG, ça peut valoir un joli détour. Le seul frein ? Pas de langue française, mais l'anglais est disponible.

26681544.review:
The game has an interesting story and it's really cute. The characters have plenty of personality, I see so many games with bland characters, I hate that just as much as I hate not having a good story to follow. There are some emotional moments, especially at the end. I love games...or anything really...that can make you actually feel something. The gameplay is also simplistic, which I don't think is a bad thing. Sure, I like a challenge, but making things too complicated can turn into a bad thing quicker than simplisity can in my opinion. Overall, I loved the game. My only real complaint is how short it is, I didn't defeat it in a single day but I could have if I had had the time to just sit and play it without interruption. Note, my recorded time is not the actual total time I played, I would often get called away in the middle of playing or would be chatting while playing, I had also started playing through for a second time in an attempt to get the rest of the achievements so do not take that as an accurate estimate of time. If I were to give a real estimate, I would say it would take 5 hours at the most, but likely less if you can just sit and play without interruption. I would have loved seeing more, but the content it does have isn't bad for the price so it's not a big complaint.

PROS
- Interesting Story
- Cute Anime Style Graphics
- Good Personality in Characters
- Emotional at Times
- Simplistic

CONS
- Too Short (But, again, it's not a big complaint, the content is decent for the price.)

26681485.review: LiEat is an interesting game which is all about exploring, whether it's inspecting items or conversating with everyone you can. The healing items you obtain can be a lifesavor for certain battles, but for the most part you can bypass the dragon goodies with Efi or Leo's overpowered skills. There will be times where you will need to speak to people in a specific order, but the character you're playing as will give you hints on what to do next. Each of the three stories has different endings for you to uncover. Though, in most situtations, you might stumble upon the abrupt ending with no happily ever after... so tread carefully! Overall, it's a hidden gem of a game. Efi herself is a truly charming young hybrid of human and dragon that makes you want to revert yourself back to your innocence. The price is exceedingly fair for the content you get out of it.

26635588.review:
Ein wirklich tolles, niedliches und teils sehr ernstes teils sehr amüsantes, vor allem aber interessantes Spiel!
Die Grafik ist klassisch, die Charaktere haben einen gewissen 'No Game No Life'-style (so ein bisschen erinnert die Beziehung der beiden Protagonisten ebenfalls an die Serie) und der Background mit der Entstehung der Drachen ist wirklich originell. 
Das Spiel besteht aus drei Teilen, die jeweils eine Episode im Leben der beiden darstellen. Theo ist Con Artist und Efi 'sein' Drache. Warum genau die Drachen, die menschliche Form haben, entstehen, wird im Verlauf der Episoden geklärt - ein Rest bleibt dennoch. Jede Episode beinhaltet eine neue 'Mission' der beiden, die Beziehung zueinander und auch die Beziehung zu den Charakteren (Polizei), die immer wieder in jeder Episode auftauchen, wird facettenreicher. Es lohnt, wie in eigentlich jedem RPG, mehrfach mit den Personen zu reden.
Jeder Teil hat eine besonders berührende Stelle, ob es nun NPCs sind oder Dialoge der beiden Protagonisten. Wenn es einen Teil gibt, den ich als etwas schwächer empfinde, so ist es der zweite, wenngleich in diesem mich die Definition "Mensch" sehr berührt und auch gefreut hat. Wow.

Das Geld ist gut investiert, jeder Teil ist liebevoll ausgearbeitet, gut durchdacht und teils sehr kniffelig.
Möchte man alle Achivements, so lohnt sich ein Blick in den entspr. Thread. 
Das Spiel ist auf Englisch btw, das Kampfsystem sehr einfach gehalten und könnte bemängelt werden, wäre es wirklich wichtig. Finde ich persönlich jetzt nicht, aber es passt zur Story ('Der Drache, der Lügen isst').

Klare Kaufempfehlung!

优点：这是一部非常棒的作品！强烈推荐！剧情音乐人设都很赞！特别是剧情这个下面慢慢说
缺点：这个游戏steam版的中文版有问题，第二次进入会直接停止运行。当时第一次从steam进停止运行后真想直接给差评，后来看了一些到目录下面找到英文版，玩了之后发现它的剧情音乐人设完全可以掩盖简中的缺陷，就是对英文苦手可能有点麻烦，听说网上有独立的中文版？

重点说下剧情[h1]下列文字可能有微剧透[/h1]
游戏总共有3个小部分组成，每个小部分都是一个独立的故事，而故事之间又有一些内在的联系，建议从头开始玩。每个故事结局有好几种，NE，BE，GE都有，所以不想看到悲剧结局的可以放心的买。（每次仙剑都是BE或者让人无限遐想的有点审美疲劳）

游戏内容：[spoiler] 基本上都是到小镇后分开-找人-睡觉-出事-分开-找人-合并线索-找出真凶，第一个故事一般般，玩了之后没有太大的感觉，可能只是介绍一下人物关系，同时引出游戏中最大的问题；第二个故事，爱与嫉妒？玩了之后基本上对游戏的设定能猜到7，8分了。第三个故事，谎言与救赎。这个故事应该才是这个游戏真正的剧情，前面两个剧情都是在为这个剧情作铺垫。真的玩了之后被感动到了，特别是NE比GE还要感动，眼泪都下来了，因此特别适合送给女生玩	[/spoiler]

一些小tips：1.游戏的战斗十分简单，基本不需要特意练级，但是最好去找到更新的装备[spoiler]它们基本都在箱子柜子垃圾箱之类的地方，多按按吧[/spoiler]
                   2.关于第三章结局触发：[spoiler]GE可能是本作唯一要练级的地方了，efi要到13级。建议先看NE再出GE[/spoiler]

26609514.review:
This game is pretty enjoyable.
For the price, I wasn't expecting much from the game, but it turned out to be better than I expected.
[list]
[*]The game has an interesting story. It starts off rough, as it feels like you are thrown into the middle of the adventure, but it makes use of letting the players know the lore and backstory of characters while leaving them very entertained. 
[*] The art style ranges from alright to good. The character sprites in the text boxes are detailed enough to portray expressions of characters (Though when a person is consumed/starting to be consumed with lies, the sprites get kinda messy and it's hard to determine expression by then). The animated and drawn scenes look interesting and show a lot of the characteristics of characters (Efi is so adorable when her eyes sparkled in II). They break away from the pixel artwork of the game, and is probably the peak of the game's art style.
[*] Gameplay is nothing to be stellar about. I beat the game holding the confirm button (which to me is the A button of the Xbox controller). It's the weakest part of the game.  Wish the combat was a little more challenging.
[*] Controls are basic and simplific. Two buttons and the arrow keys/WASD/D-Pad.
[*] This game has no difficulty. Probably one of the easiest games I have ever played in my life. I wouldn't be suprised if a monkey was able to beat the game.
[*] Sound track is catchy, but cuts when tracks loop over, which is sort of an annoyance.
[/list]
This game sets up an interesting world, but I feel somewhat that there could have been more to this game. Part of me feels empty, like I don't have all the answers I want yet. Hopefully there will be a sequel to this game (high chance that there won't be because of the ending, but I can dream).

26593493.review:
TL;DR 
Short, but quite enjoyable RPG game, great for when you don't have a large amount of time to spend on a game, or need to be able to disengage easily. It has a nice little story (the game is mostly story telling, not much RPG action), and cute pixel graphics. Only thing that bothered me was the controls, (would have liked to use WASD instead of UpDownLeftRight).


I bought this because I was feeling brain fried from studying and needed a short break, but I had to be able to get off and go back to studying in a reasonable amount of time: this meant staying away from long or addictive games, and definitely staying away from Youtube and Netflix.

LiEat is actually three short games in one, each taking about 1.5 -  2 hours to complete, so I could play through an arc and get back to studying without a burning desire to get back to playing. 

As far as gameplay goes, while there are some standard elements of a JRPG (turn based fighting, leveling up, items, and what not), these seem secondary to the story telling. Each arc, or game, revolves around some mystery that gradually reveals the history of the characters, and as such the bulk of the gameplay is running around talking to various NPCs or searching for clues, which is not bad if you enjoy a good story. 

The only thing that really bothered me about this game was the control scheme. I would have liked to use WASD or a control pad for movement, but you are forced to use UpDownLeftRight. 

Ultimately I would recommend this game to anyone who likes a good story, has little time/doesn't want to get too involved, or is a fan of cute pixel art.

26577086.review:
The most important thing you should know about LiEat is that IT'S NOT AN RPG.
LiEat is a visual novel stuffed in the RPG format.

Combat, gear, HP and SP are purely an accessory to telling a story.
They're trivial and pose no difficulty.

This is how you'll spend 95% of your time in the game:
-reading through NPC dialogue;
-walking from place A to place B to talk to an NPC, or go pick up an item;
-walking aimlessly to find place B that will progress the story because no one hinted at what or where it is.

Combat is just padding between the actions above. You'd have to make an effort to die, and you can get out of every encounter by keeping A pressed to basically auto-attack.

I don't have a problem with story driven games. The problem is when they're advertised as something they're not.
I think this type of doujin game isn't simply cut for the western market, or at least not for a storefront like Steam... But apparently the other reviews think otherwise.

Anyway, if you can get past the above, the story is run-of-the-mill cute anime; it's nothing special, but it works. It feels like watching one of those random 11-episode anime that you find passable as you're watching them, only to forget them them in a couple of weeks after you're done watching the last episode and being mildly dissatisfied.

The Steam release is made up of 3 shorter games (LiEat 1 to 3) which tell three different stories about the two main characters visiting three different locations and working on as many mysteries/crimes. These all consist in small locations where you run around completing fetch quests, with all the triggers (item hidden in a bookshelf, picture found in a book, note in the trash can...) that don't activate until you've hit a certain story flag, so get ready to search all the trash cans in the area each time you progress with the story.

In short, unless you're a very bored very game-hungry anime fan, avoid this game as it's not worth the time needed to drag yourself through it.

26515849.review:
A nice compelation of the three LiEat games. I've always loved Miwashibas games, and while LiEat is actually my least favorite of their works, it's still a nice series in it's own ways. Miwashibas art is great, and other then 1bitheart's sprites, it feels the most polished in the pure amount of CG's and Movies that are in the game. Miwashiba has also always had great character designs in general, and with how the main characters change in appearance (Efinas papa especially) it's fun seeing how they evolve.

The story can be enjoyable depending on your preference. For the most part it feels like episodical games ala shonen anime, but the first game is somewhat connected to it's prologue novel, and the last game is very character centric over the main characters past. I do feel like there should have been more fleshing out on the characters and story, and the battle system honestly isn't neccessary. I think Miwashiba realized that fault, since their later game doesn't include a battle system at all, instead opting for Dangan Ronpa/Ace Attorney style gameplay.  All in all, LiEat has it's faults, but it is genuinly a fun and beautiful game to play, and I also reccomend playing miwashibas other games, Alice_Mare and 1bitheart if you find yourself enjoying miwashibas storytelling, characters, and art.

A series of short, cute mystery RPGs. The graphics style took a bit to get used to, but after a while it grew on me. It's a unique art style from what I know, and it's actually kind of cute. The music is pretty good, too, and the 3 games are each like episodic parts of the universe that serve as character development. That being said, I still recommend playing them in order so as to understand the overarcing plot better. As for the combat and gameplay, it's rather simple, with you facing off against lies (there's no consequence really if you mislabel truths and lies) and using pretty much the same strategy for each boss. The story is good, though it's pretty linear, which is fine. There are, of course, bad and good endings, so I guess it's not 100% linear in that manner.

Tldr; if you want a short mystery story with a cute art style, some combat, and good music, here's a good one right here.

因此前两个故事老实说，比较平淡，第一个挺俗套的，第二个云里雾里，像是一场闹剧
但是！第三个故事也就是主线令人眼前一亮，这样说吧
请一定不要错过第三个故事，有些设定甚至会戳你泪点，如果你喜欢[spoiler]野良神。。 里的夜斗（说太多瑟瑟发抖）[/spoiler]

26413504.review:
LiEat is one of those rare RPGs that are heavily focused on the story compared to other stuff, similar to Wadanohara, Mogeko Castle and Ib if your familiar with some other works VGperson translated. I had a bit of experience with some of these before I played this, but LiEat is special to me.

Music:
All of the music is just fantastic and great music, it really sets the mood of the game as well as the situation. I would love it if there was a remastered soundtrack or something, I'd be willing to buy it if there was such a thing. Like most RPG Maker games, the music is free-to-use type of music. So finding it is a matter of finding the one who wrote it.

Characters:
There are a lot of interesting characters, but the most interesting our are main two: The con artist that goes by many names (such as Leo, Harold and Sid) Leo and Efina, a young dragon that can eat lies. Most of the characters are brand new each game and range from likeable to just not caring much about, but these two are always there and have a great connection with on another. At its core, I'd say these two make it a buddy story in my eyes. Leo is the serious work focused character that keeps to himself and doesn't like talking about his past, while Efina is the young carefree  character that is still trying to understand things and can be reckless but cares deeply about the people she meets. The two have the child and caretaker relationship, but they play off of each other and grow from being with one another so well.

Gameplay:
Here is where I have to give a bit of a negative. While I know there are some RPG games that are easy, even they have challenging moments despite the low difficulty. LiEat on the other hand, like Wadanohara, is far too easy. There is hardly any strategy and the only way you can lose is if your too cocky and don't pay attention (and heal) or lose on purpose to get a bad ending. Unlike Wadanohara though, this game does have a bit of varity although very, VERT small. Aside from attacking, enemies might defend to reduce damage or charge up to deal more damage with their next attack. Some can also take a lot of hits and do require some strategy such as increasing defense and attack, but even then the fights usually are still fairly easy. The only fights I found challenging were some of the bosses in the third game of this pack, but that is of course if your a low grinder and only do what is needed to get the good ending. Overall, gameplay isn't terribly easy but still suffers from being far too easy.

Story:
I'm going to keep this one short as I actually say it woud be better to experience this amazing story on your own. LiEat is compose of three games that make up one huge story, in each Leo and Efina go around and uncover mysteries in the places they vist as Efi learns more about humans, about why she eats lies, and about Teo's past and why he lies a lot. In turn, Teo learns to trust Efi more and slowly becomes willing to tell her a bit about himself to her as well as lessening his lying. The first game focuses on a town where a wolf is said to attack people and its vampire legend, the second focuses on the two looking for more info on dragons by exploring a town that is rumored to have a dream-eating dragon. The final game concludes the story as the two look into the mysteries of the phantom thief, which I can't even say much due to very big spoilers as this was by far my favorite of the three. There are many lessons that could be given in these stories, as I believe stories should have a hidden message for the viewers to take in their lives. LiEats is the danger of telling too many lies, even if you had good intentions behind them and the lies could controll you. It's a heartwarming tale with a great message.

LiEat is a fantastic short RPG Maker game, the full game can take up to three hours long to finish with each of the three taking about 55 minutes to an hour or so to finish. It is certainly worth getting and playing. Heck, if your not sure if you want to buy it despite it being only $3, you can download it to try it on VGpersons site and if you like it enough to show support, buy the Steam version like I did. There isn't many changes between the regular and the steam version, except for it comes with all three instead of having to download all three one at a time. Yes the battles are far too easy, but there is a small amount of varity that at least makes up for it minorly and the rest of the points prove to be much stronger. I'd highly recommend getting this game if your looking for a short good RPG story to dig into, you won't regret it and if you say you did, you better call Efina to eat that lie.

26314456.review:
I don't often make reviews, due to most video games being pretty naff. But this one? Oh boy, this indie game is quite something else. It's worth the few coins it costs, definitely. It's a very big shame they stopped at 3 games (all are included), they could have made so much more. The games themselves were about 2 hours long each (give or take) and though at the start you're kinda just thrown into this world without any back story you eventually find out about every character. An overall great game with 3 VERY touching endings, though they could have done so, so much more. The levels themselves weren't very large and didnt have much going on in them, mostly story, they could have expanded on the puzzles a lot but they only really introduced puzzels at the end, (the final bit of the LiEat 3 was really the only amazing part) and they didn't touch on character items almost at all, 2 weapons each per game sometimes a 2nd hand weapon and only once did you get armour for the Efi (but not Teo) and there was no 3rd accessory, despite there being space for one. I felt like some game mechanics weren't finished, and so much could have been expanded upon for an even better version of this game; if the rest of the story was as full of puzzels, plot devices and atmosphere like in the last one I'm sure It would have been even more amazing - stating it was already good without it.

If the story doesnt get you, the music will. I dont know how they do it but the music fills me with despair and loneliness, even before I started the actual game. Good job, 8/10 from me!

26124848.review:
This is a title that is both stylistically charming and surprisingly engaging given its brevity. Gameplay is minimal, but the elements are familiar. This serves as a comfortable media from which to enjoy the narrative, and does so in such a manner that does not leave one feeling as though something is missing.

LiEat follows the story of Efina, a lie-eating dragon who appears to be between the ages of 3 and 5 (depending on the chapter of the game), and her caretaker 'Leo', an informant/investigator who assumes many identities in his trade. It is in this story that you get to learn along with Efina, discovering her world, about herself, and unraveling the lies of those she cares for.

While short, this is a title accomplishes quite a bit, and I think it is worth the investment.

LiEat is a RPGmaker mystery game where the player plays as either "Hal" or Efi (the protagonists). You venture around a small map where you search for clues, talk to various and fun characters, and solve crimes as well as learn more about the con artist and dragon duo.

Personally, I'd rate this game 10/10. I highly recommend it to those of you looking for something to help pass the time and calm you down.

25863510.review:
[h1]In brief:[/h1]
I picked this up, wanting a short narrative experience. Eight leisurely hours later I’d completed its three chapters and was satisfied.

[h1]As a game:[/h1]
I struggle to call this a game, it’s much more a choose-your-own adventure with RPG elements. Even then, there are a total of eight story branches, five are sudden death through different means, and the three ‘good’ endings at each of the chapters. So, really, you’re just along for the ride. Leveling, skills, equips are all but superfluous, and easy-mode weapons are easily obtainable.

[h1]As a story:[/h1]
It’s fluff. Enjoyable, but still fluff. It draws upon the type of clichés you’d expect, without being lost in the quagmire of tropes. The world is ambiguous enough in it fantastical bearings it doesn’t breach into ridiculousness, while being out there enough to suspend disbelief and take you along for the ride. Bonus points for not hating either of the protagonists, which is nice. By this, my criteria, it’s good fluff.

[h1]Closing thoughts:[/h1]
After you get all achievements, an easy enough task, there’s effectively zero replay value. Not a problem for the cost of entry. If price is a deterrent, for whatever reason, the developer has it free to download [url=http://lieat.ifdef.jp/]on their website[/url] (including English).

The character design/art is well done, understated, and grooves with the general atmosphere. The three-second animations fit both stylistically and thematically, leaving me wanting more. The soundtrack isn’t outstanding, but it works well enough, and satisfactorily fills the silence.

I have a lot of praise for the game, likely because I had very little expectation. I was delighted with what I was given, which is why I have no reserve in recommending it – so long as you’re in a mood for fluff.

25554158.review:
This is the perfect example of a short, yet sweet game that's humble enough not to be overpriced. At it's current value, I can safely say that it's worth every penny you invest in it. But, what kind of game is this anyways?

LiEat is a story focused RPG, divided into three bite-sized chapters. Each of these has its own unique story following a young lie eating dragon girl named Efina and her mysterious caretaker, who continously changes his name and appearance with each new chapter. Story wise, there's not much I can say without spoiling it for you, but while this game doesn't do anything ground breaking in this department, it has its own merits that warrant making an emphasis on it.
While you do engage in combat against small critters, they're really not hard fights. If anything, they exist for symbolic purposes only, as you can break the game combat-wise very early on in each chapter by finding the legendary variants of your initial equipment in not-so-subtle places around the map.

The closest I could compare this game to for people who're wary about RPGMaker-like games on Steam are like those one shot manga you'd find at a convention that were so well received by the adventurous few that gave it a try, that you get to see a sequel in the following year's gathering. Except you get all three in one package for no aditional price.

I'd recommend this game over any 99 cents joke game on Steam any day.

25540335.review:
A story-driven rpg with a great soundtrack and premise. Its composed of 3 games that are about 1~2 hours each, more if you want to scour the games for all the secrets and different endings.
Definitely a worthwhile game to pick up and play, especially with such a low price.

Now, I cannot call it just a RPG or a puzzle game, cause it is an abomination of those genres. RPG materials, puzzles on each part and lotsa characters. You know, a triple.

I am gonna cut this review to parts cause if I don't I feel like it's gonna be fairly clugged up. The game doesn't really have gameplay, as you can just get the OP weapons on each part if you really feel like it.

First of all, characters:

You aren't given, like, huge logs of info about each character. When you end a chapter, you are given a decent amount of info on every minor and major character of that specific part. While playing, you are given info more about their personality than specific likes and dislikes. Which is GREAT cause nobody cares about what a fucking character likes eating or what their fucking hobby is, I am here for the actually important shit.

Gameplay:

THERE ARE PUZZLES AND YOU SOLVE THEM

WHO GIVES A FUCK ABOUT GAMEPLAY STORY'S THE MAIN THING OF THIS GAME

Sprites and shit:

Music:

My god, the music.

MY GOD, THE MUSIC.

I-It's just so pleasing, so chill, so fucking amazing!

It's basically a blessing that the creator of LiEat also gives you the OST if you buy the game. Each area owns it's own music for every mood it needs to deliver! And as far as I heard, you never hear the music you heard a chapter's music on the other chapters too!

I am sorry if I sound really pumped up about it, I just really love this OST.

Anyway, my final thing, the story:

I do not want to go on for long, so let me give you a summary:

The main character, Teo and his little dragon lie eating daughter Efi visit towns and sell information they can gather while Efi eats up all the lies they bump into. There are also a large police force of dragons and their main objective is to free every enslaved dragon and protect them, even sometimes hire them! The captain of the force, Neil and his vice captain Brett are familiar with Teo and his little shenanigans. They usually come up after specific murder cases have occurred, like actual police would. Teo and Efi usually meet up with these two on each town they visit, except every time they see each other, Teo and Efi have different clothing and etc. When you sell info and eat lies you shouldn't be running around with the same clothing, should you now?

The story's worth looking into by yourself IMO, it's pretty cool!

In my opinion, this game is worth picking up and playing 'till the end. But hey, I am weeb trash for playing this according to the internet, what do I know?

25490065.review:
GLANCE RECOMMENDATION: [u][b]100% YES[/b][/u] / 00% NO

[h1]GOOD[/h1]
[list]
[*]Exceedingly cute art and animation.
[*]Length of each adventure is so perfectly bite-sized.
[*]Sound effects are super crisp and enjoyable.
[*]Battles are perfect for a short adventure and are as difficult as you make it, if you feel like hunting around the maps for better equipment or leveling up a bit.
[*]Despite the items and skills not really changing much per chapter, they're short enough to feel fun and fill the gap between conversations just fine.
[*]The stories are different and all enjoyable. Fun little looks into the lore of dragons, beasts, and lies.
[*]Surprising amount of hidden conversations and multiple endings. Even hidden items that make you well overpowered.
[*]Gratifying rooms at the end of chapters to look at art stills or the sequences to your hearts content. ALso includes fun bios and a jukebox.
[/list]

[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
This is a first. I usually find something to nitpick, even in a mild way, but this game is just so perfect in its scope and what it achieves. You get three mini adventures for such a small price, packed with hidden conversations and loads of achievements, this is fully worth the $3 price point. There's a reason this is rated so highly and I'm glad I came to the same conclusion.

Now that I have finished the first Act of three in total I must say that its a sad sight for me that the game is only being sold at such a low price.

Going past a few minor typos that one can easily miss as well if you wont pay that much attention to it the game is already pretty good. A good old RPG with a good little Story.

A lie-eating Dragon, huh? I find this just very interesting.

The game plays as you expect it. A Top-Down 2D RPG with a little Battlesystem that reminded me a little of Earthbound. The graphics are really, really nice and the music fits to every scene.

And to be honest: For the first Act alone I wouldve paid 5 Euro. Yes, it is a small game that can be played through fast. But you can see how much work was put into it. And that is the point. Graphics, Writing, Idea and even small but good-looking animations.

And we get all that, three times within one game, for this price?
